appeal(uint256,bytes).details: Appeal a ruling. Note that it has to be called before the arbitrator contract calls rule.

params._disputeID: ID of the dispute to be appealed.
params._extraData: Can be used to give extra info on the appeal.

appealCost(uint256,bytes).details: Compute the cost of appeal. It is recommended not to increase it often, as it can be highly time and gas consuming for the arbitrated contracts to cope with fee augmentation.

params._disputeID: ID of the dispute to be appealed.
params._extraData: Can be used to give additional info on the dispute to be created.

appealPeriod(uint256).details: Compute the start and end of the dispute's current or next appeal period, if possible.

arbitrationCost(bytes).details: Compute the cost of arbitration. It is recommended not to increase it often, as it can be highly time and gas consuming for the arbitrated contracts to cope with fee augmentation.

params._extraData: Can be used to give additional info on the dispute to be created.

createDispute(uint256,bytes).details: Create a dispute. Must be called by the arbitrable contract.  Must be paid at least arbitrationCost(_extraData).

params._choices: Amount of choices the arbitrator can make in this dispute.
params._extraData: Can be used to give additional info on the dispute to be created.

currentRuling(uint256).details: Return the current ruling of a dispute. This is useful for parties to know if they should appeal.

returns.ruling: The ruling which has been given or the one which will be given if there is no appeal.

disputeStatus(uint256).details: Return the status of a dispute.

params._disputeID: ID of the dispute to rule.

typeDescriptions.typeString: literal_string "Not enough ETH to cover arbitration costs."

arguments.value: Not enough ETH to cover arbitration costs.

argumentTypes.typeString: literal_string "Not enough ETH to cover arbitration costs."

typeDescriptions.typeString: literal_string "Not enough ETH to cover appeal costs."

arguments.value: Not enough ETH to cover appeal costs.

argumentTypes.typeString: literal_string "Not enough ETH to cover appeal costs."

documentation.text:
@title Arbitrator
  @author Clment Lesaege - <clement@lesaege.com>
  Arbitrator abstract contract.
  When developing arbitrator contracts we need to:
  -Define the functions for dispute creation (createDispute) and appeal (appeal). Don't forget to store the arbitrated contract and the disputeID (which should be unique, use nbDisputes).
  -Define the functions for cost display (arbitrationCost and appealCost).
  -Allow giving rulings. For this a function must call arbitrable.rule(disputeID, ruling).
